alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 12 at 2:34PM EST until January 15 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SATURDAY TO 7 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, with up to 18 inches possible in the most persistent lake effect bands. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Southeastern St. Lawrence County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to noon EST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 PM Saturday to 7 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...For the Winter Storm Warning, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility Saturday night into Sunday. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snowfall rates up to 1 inch per hour are possible for a brief period during the pre-dawn hours on Saturday before mixing with and changing to rain. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. The lake effect snow event may persist for an extended duration.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
